page.title: 10Family Leisure in Harpenden
page.content: Tiffany, our dog, takes my family for long walks over the Common and into the Park. With my friend I cycle along the Nicky Line (probably so called because its Navvy builders wore knickerbockers) where wild plants grow. A lonely signal reminds us that it was once a busy railway line from Harpenden to Hemel Hempstead. Friday is Beefeater night where we have fish, chips and ice-cream. My Mum and Dad eat steak and drink wine. Dad likes inventing computer games. My Mum plays squash, and the piano too. Grandad's pride and joy is his allotment where he grows prize veg.. My Mum likes singing in the Light Operatic Soc. and Dad likes carving wooden swords. My brother's in Scouts, my sister's in Guides and I'm a Cub. Written by Suzy, Clare and Tom.
